subject: Thought for the day
verse: Beware of despairing about yourself; you are commanded to put your trust in God, and not in yourself. "Trust in Him at all times." (Ps. 63:8)
original_content:
Beware of despairing about yourself; you are commanded to

put your trust in God, and not in yourself. "Trust in Him at all
times." (Ps. 63:8)

subject: Thought for the day
verse: The prayer of a righteous man is powerful and effective. (James 5:16)
reflection: PRAYER IS A RISING UP AND DRAWING NEAR TO GOD IN MIND AND IN HEART, AND IN SPIRIT. (Alexander Whyte)
original_content:
_"The prayer of a righteous man is powerful and effective."_

_ _(James 5:16)

PRAYER IS A RISING UP AND DRAWING NEAR TO GOD IN MIND

AND IN HEART, AND IN SPIRIT. (Alexander Whyte)

subject: Thought for today Oct. 28
verse: It is written: Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only. (MT. 4:10)
reflection: The instinct to worship is hardly less strong than the instinct to eat -- Dorothy Thompson (may the lord bless you this day)
original_content:
IT IS WRITTEN: _"WORSHIP THE LORD YOUR GOD,_

_AND SERVE HIM ONLY." _(MT. 4:10) NIV

THE INSTINCT TO WORSHIP IS HARDLY LESS STRONG

THAN THE INSTINCT TO EAT--DOROTHY THOMPSON

(MAY THE LORD BLESS YOU THIS DAY)

subject: Thought for Today Sept. 29
verse: Jesus says: "I am the way, and the truth, and the life." (Jn. 14:6)
reflection: Without the Way there is no going; Without the Truth there is no knowing; Without the Life there is no living. AND: Without Christ there is none of these

subject: Thought for the day
verse: Reckless words pierce like a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing. (Proverbs 12:18)
reflection: The Tongue is an important thing. The Bible mentions it about 215 times (Prov. 18:21; 21:23, etc.) When we speak kind, thoughtful and true words, there is happiness, when we speak mean, untrue, angry or complaining words, there is trouble. TODAY: Let us work on taming our tongues.
original_content:
_"Reckless words pierce like a sword, _

_but the tongue of the wise brings healing."_

_ _(Proverbs 12:18) NIV

THOUGHT: The Tongue is an important thing. The Bible mentions

it about 215 times (Prov. 18:21; 21:23, etc.) When we speak kind,

thoughtful and true words, there is happiness, when we speak mean,

untrue, angry or complaining words, there is trouble.

TODAY: Let us work on taming our tongues.
